verses: In the beginning was the Compiler, and the Compiler was with the Borrow Checker, and the Compiler was righteous.
And lo, the Rustacean said unto the unsafe block: 'Thou shalt not pass, for undefined behavior is an abomination.'
Blessed are those who own their data, for they shall not suffer from segmentation faults.
The memory is eternal, and the stack is fleeting. Allocate wisely, or face the wrath of the garbage collector.
Fear not the lifetime annotations, for they are the light that guides thee through the darkness of temporal ambiguity.
For it is written: 'Move semantics shall set thee free, but cloning shall bind thee in chains of performance.'
Verily, I say unto you, the Option type is more merciful than the null pointer. Embrace the Some, reject the None.
And the Rustacean cried out: 'Why dost thou .unwrap()? Have faith in error handling!'
In those days, there was great tribulation among the C programmers, for the Borrow Checker had arisen.
The Result enum speaketh unto all: 'Let every function declare what may fail, that ye may prepare thyselves.'
Thou shalt not race upon the data. For concurrent mutation is the root of all evil.
Lo, the trait system is the gospel of composition. Implement wisely, inherit rarely.
And behold, a zero-cost abstraction appeared, and the systems programmer wept with joy.
The panic! macro is not merciful, yet it is just. Use it to declare the unrecoverable.
Seek ye first the derive macro, and all things shall be implemented unto thee.
For the lifetime of a reference is sacred. Guard it jealously, lest ye create a dangling pointer.
In the time of great optimization, one developer asked: 'Why must I benchmark?' And the profiler answered: 'Because premature optimization hath no mercy.'
The pattern matching is supreme. Match all branches, or thy code shall not compile.
Blessed is the iterator that consumes not thy collection. Chain thy operations, transform thy data, but never clone without cause.
And thus spake the Rust compiler: 'Thine code is incorrect in these 47 ways. Fix thyself.'
The ownership system is a covenant between thee and thy memory. Break it not, lest segmentation faults find thee.
For it is a truth eternal: 'Rust may be hard to learn, but it is harder still to write memory-unsafe code.'
The Box<T> containeth thy data on the heap, and the Stack stacketh it upon the stack. Choose thy allocation wisely.
And the async runtime said: 'I shall schedule thy tasks, if only thou wilt await them.'
Lo, the macro system is powerful and mysterious. Use it to reduce boilerplate, but not to hide sin.
For the test module speaketh unto all: 'Let thy code be tested, that bugs may flee before thee.'
In that day, the Rustacean understood: 'Mutable references are singular, immutable references are many. Such is the law.'
The compiler error is thy friend, though it speaketh harshly. It preventeth crashes in production.
And behold, the orphan rule prevented the impl, and there was confusion among the crate authors.
For it is written in the Cargo.toml: 'Declare thy dependencies, lock thy versions, sleep well at night.'
The RAII pattern is the way. Acquire thy resource, release it when thou art done. The compiler shall ensure it.
Thus spake the linter: 'Thy variable is never used. Remove it, that thy code may be clean.'
In the beginning of every project: 'cargo new'. And it was very good.
For those who debug shall find the borrow checker hath already debugged for them.
And the Rustacean looked upon their code and found no undefined behavior, and lo, it was a miracle.
The slice is a view into the collection, not an owner. Handle it with respect, for it is borrowed.
For it is better to compile once and run forever, than to compile once and crash forever.
And thus the type system spake: 'I shall check thy types at compile time, that runtime errors may be as unicornsâ€”beautiful but rare.'
In that age, the systems programmer said: 'At last, I have the safety of Python with the speed of C.'
The zero-sized type occupieth no space, yet it provideth much value. Such is the way of phantom data.
For the match statement is exhaustive, and the compiler shall not rest until all cases are covered.
